meanings.definition: The quality or state of being motivated by money or material gain.
meanings.sent1: His mercenariness was evident in his decision to take the job solely for the high salary.
meanings.sent2: The mercenariness of the businessman led him to prioritize profits over ethics.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mercenariness, he still had a kind heart when it came to helping those in need.
meanings.sent4: Her mercenariness in business was like a sharp blade cutting through the competition.
meanings.sent5: The mercenariness of the character made him a memorable villain in the story.

meanings.definition: The act of being a mercenary or hired soldier.
meanings.sent1: The mercenariness of the soldier was evident in his willingness to fight for whoever paid the most.
meanings.sent2: In times of war, mercenariness becomes a common practice as armies seek additional support.
meanings.sent3: The comical play portrayed the mercenariness of the characters in a lighthearted manner.
meanings.sent4: Her mercenariness on the battlefield was like a skilled dancer moving swiftly and strategically.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of the mercenariness in the ancient tales brought the stories to life.
